getWalletNetWorth.description: Get the net worth of a wallet in USD. We recommend to filter out spam tokens and unverified contracts to get a more accurate result.

queryParams.name: chains
queryParams.description: The chains to query.

queryParams.name: exclude_spam
queryParams.description: Exclude spam tokens from the result

queryParams.name: exclude_unverified_contracts
queryParams.description: Exclude unverified contracts from the result

queryParams.name: max_token_inactivity
queryParams.description: Exclude tokens inactive for more than the given amount of days

queryParams.name: min_pair_side_liquidity_usd
queryParams.description: Exclude tokens with liquidity less than the specified amount in USD. This parameter refers to the liquidity on a single side of the pair.

responses.description: Returns the net worth and chain balance data.

fields.name: total_networth_usd
fields.description: The total net worth in USD

fields.name: chains
fields.description: An array of chain balance objects

fields.name: chain
fields.description: The identifier for the blockchain (e.g., 'eth' for Ethereum)

fields.name: native_balance

fields.name: native_balance_formatted
fields.description: The formatted balance of the native currency on the chain

fields.name: native_balance_usd
fields.description: The USD value of the native currency balance

fields.name: token_balance_usd

fields.name: networth_usd

getWalletHistory.summary: Get the complete history of a wallet
getWalletHistory.description: Retrieve the full transaction history of a specified wallet address, including sends, receives, token and NFT transfers, and contract interactions.

queryParams.name: chain
queryParams.description: The chain to query

queryParams.name: from_block
queryParams.description:
The minimum block number from which to get the transactions
* Provide the param 'from_block' or 'from_date'
* If 'from_date' and 'from_block' are provided, 'from_block' will be used.

queryParams.name: to_block
queryParams.description:
The maximum block number from which to get the transactions.
* Provide the param 'to_block' or 'to_date'
* If 'to_date' and 'to_block' are provided, 'to_block' will be used.

queryParams.name: from_date
queryParams.description:
The start date from which to get the transactions (format in seconds or datestring accepted by momentjs)
* Provide the param 'from_block' or 'from_date'
* If 'from_date' and 'from_block' are provided, 'from_block' will be used.

queryParams.name: to_date
queryParams.description:
Get the transactions up to this date (format in seconds or datestring accepted by momentjs)
* Provide the param 'to_block' or 'to_date'
* If 'to_date' and 'to_block' are provided, 'to_block' will be used.

queryParams.name: include_internal_transactions
queryParams.description: If the result should contain the internal transactions.

queryParams.name: nft_metadata
queryParams.description: If the result should contain the nft metadata.

queryParams.name: cursor
queryParams.description: The cursor returned in the previous response (used for getting the next page).

queryParams.name: order
queryParams.description: The order of the result, in ascending (ASC) or descending (DESC)

queryParams.name: limit
queryParams.description: The desired page size of the result.

responses.description: Returns the transaction data.

fields.name: page
fields.description: The current page number in the paginated result set

fields.name: page_size
fields.description: The number of items per page in the paginated result set

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination

fields.name: result

getWalletProfitabilitySummary.description: Retrieves a summary of wallet profitability based on specified parameters including optional token addresses.

queryParams.name: days
queryParams.description: Timeframe in days for the profitability summary. Options include 'all', '7', '30', '60', '90' default is 'all'.

queryParams.name: chain
queryParams.description: The chain to query

responses.description: Successful response with the profitability summary.

fields.name: total_count_of_trades
fields.description: Total count of trades executed by the wallet.

fields.name: total_trade_volume
fields.description: Total trade volume managed by the wallet.

fields.name: total_realized_profit_usd
fields.description: Total realized profit in USD for the wallet.

fields.name: total_realized_profit_percentage
fields.description: Total realized profit as a percentage.

fields.name: total_buys
fields.description: Total number of buy transactions.

fields.name: total_sells
fields.description: Total number of sell transactions.

fields.name: total_sold_volume_usd
fields.description: Total USD volume of tokens sold by the wallet.

fields.name: total_bought_volume_usd
fields.description: Total USD volume of tokens bought by the wallet.

getWalletProfitability.description: Retrieves profitability information for a specific wallet address. Can be filtered by one or more tokens.

pathParams.name: address
pathParams.description: The wallet address for which profitability is to be retrieved.

queryParams.name: days
queryParams.description: Timeframe in days for which profitability is calculated, Options include 'all', '7', '30', '60', '90' default is 'all'.

queryParams.name: chain
queryParams.description: The chain to query

queryParams.name: token_addresses
queryParams.description: The token addresses list to filter the result with

responses.description: Successful response with profitability data.

fields.name: result
fields.description: List of tokens traded with their respective profitability data.

fields.name: token_address
fields.description: The address of the traded token.

fields.name: avg_buy_price_usd
fields.description: Average buy price in USD.

fields.name: avg_sell_price_usd
fields.description: Average sell price in USD.

getWalletNFTs.description:
Get NFTs owned by a given address.
* The response will include status [SYNCED/SYNCING] based on the contracts being indexed.
* Use the token_address param to get results for a specific contract only
* Note that results will include all indexed NFTs
* Any request that includes the token_address param will start the indexing process for that NFT collection the very first time it is requested.

queryParams.name: chain
queryParams.description: The chain to query

queryParams.name: format
queryParams.description: The format of the token ID

queryParams.name: limit
queryParams.description: The desired page size of the result.

queryParams.name: exclude_spam
queryParams.description: Should spam NFTs be excluded from the result?

queryParams.name: token_addresses
queryParams.description: The non-fungible token (NFT) addresses to get balances for

queryParams.name: cursor
queryParams.description: The cursor returned in the previous response (used for getting the next page).

queryParams.name: normalizeMetadata
queryParams.description: The option to enable metadata normalization. Learn more about metadata normalization [here](/web3-data-api/evm/normalized-vs-non-normalized-metadata).

queryParams.name: media_items
queryParams.description: Should preview media data be returned? Learn more about media items [here](/web3-data-api/evm/nft-image-previews).

responses.description: Returns a collection of NFT owners

fields.name: status
fields.description: The syncing status of the address [SYNCING/SYNCED]

fields.name: total
fields.description: The total number of matches for this query

fields.name: page
fields.description: The current page of the result

fields.name: page_size
fields.description: The number of results per page

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: The cursor to get to the next page

fields.name: token_address
fields.description: The address of the NFT contract

fields.name: token_id
fields.description: The token ID of the NFT

fields.name: contract_type
fields.description: The type of NFT contract standard

fields.name: owner_of
fields.description: The wallet address of the owner of the NFT

fields.name: block_number
fields.description: The block number when the amount or owner changed

fields.name: block_number_minted
fields.description: The block number when the NFT was minted

fields.name: token_uri
fields.description: The URI to the metadata of the token

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: The metadata of the token

fields.name: normalized_metadata
fields.description: A normalized metadata version of the NFT's metadata.

name.description: The name or title of the NFT

description.description: A detailed description of the NFT
description.example: Moralis Coffee nug 3D Asset that can be used in 3D worldspaces. This NFT is presented as a flat PNG, a Unity3D Prefab and a standard fbx.

image.description: The URL of the NFT's image

animation_url.description: An animated version of the NFT's image

fields.name: media
fields.description: A set of links to 'thumbnail / preview' media files

mimetype.description: The mimetype of the media file [see https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/MIME_types/Common_types]

status.description:
successThe NFT Preview was created / retrieved successfully
processingThe NFT Preview was not found and has been submitted for generation.
unsupported_mediaThe mime-type of the NFT's media file indicates a type not currently supported.
invalid_urlThe 'image' URL from the NFT's metadata is not a valid URL and cannot be processed.
host_unavailableThe 'image' URL from the NFT's metadata returned an HttpCode indicating the host / file is not available.
temporarily_unavailableThe attempt to load / parse the NFT media file failed (usually due to rate limiting) and will be tried again at next request.

original_media_url.description: The url of the original media file.

updatedAt.description: The timestamp of the last update to this NFT media record.

parent_hash.description: Hash value of the original media file.

media_collection.description: Preview item associated with the original

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The number of this item the user owns (used by ERC1155)

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the NFT contract

fields.name: symbol
fields.description: The symbol of the NFT contract

fields.name: token_hash
fields.description: The token hash

fields.name: rarity_rank
fields.description: The rarity rank

fields.name: rarity_label
fields.description: The rarity label

fields.name: rarity_percentage
fields.description: The rarity percentage

fields.name: last_token_uri_sync
fields.description: When the token_uri was last updated

fields.name: last_metadata_sync
fields.description: When the metadata was last updated

fields.name: possible_spam
fields.description: Indicates if a contract is possibly a spam contract

fields.name: verified_collection
fields.description: Indicates if a contract is verified. Currently supported for ethereum NFT contracts.

The minimum block number from which to get the transfers
* Provide the param 'from_block' or 'from_date'
* If 'from_date' and 'from_block' are provided, 'from_block' will be used.

queryParams.description:
The date from where to get the transfers (any format that is accepted by momentjs)
* Provide the param 'from_block' or 'from_date'
* If 'from_date' and 'from_block' are provided, 'from_block' will be used.

queryParams.name: to_date
queryParams.description:
Get transfers up until this date (any format that is accepted by momentjs)
* Provide the param 'to_block' or 'to_date'
* If 'to_date' and 'to_block' are provided, 'to_block' will be used.

reSyncMetadata.description:
Resync the metadata for an NFT
* The metadata flag will request the NFT's metadata from an already existing token_uri
* The uri (default) flag will fetch the latest token_uri from the given NFT contract address. In sync mode the metadata will also be fetched
* The sync mode will make the endpoint synchronous so it will wait for the task to be completed before responding
* The async mode (default) will make the endpoint asynchronous so we will wait for the task to be completed before responding

pathParams.name: address
pathParams.description: The address of the NFT contract

queryParams.name: chain
queryParams.description: The chain to query

queryParams.name: flag
queryParams.description: The type of resync to operate

queryParams.name: mode
queryParams.description: To define the behaviour of the endpoint

responses.description: (In sync mode) Resync request executed.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of the resync request

responses.description: The resync request was received and will be executed.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of the resync request

responses.description: (In sync mode) Resync request executed and metadata could not be updated.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of the resync request

getNFTTradesByToken.description: Get trades of NFTs for a given contract and token ID.

pathParams.name: address
pathParams.description: The address of the NFT contract

pathParams.name: token_id
pathParams.description: The token ID of the NFT contract

queryParams.name: chain
queryParams.description: The chain to query

queryParams.name: from_block
queryParams.description:
The minimum block number from which to get the transfers
* Provide the param 'from_block' or 'from_date'
* If 'from_date' and 'from_block' are provided, 'from_block' will be used.

queryParams.name: to_block
queryParams.description: The block number to get the trades from

queryParams.name: from_date
queryParams.description:
The start date from which to get the transfers (format in seconds or datestring accepted by momentjs)
* Provide the param 'from_block' or 'from_date'
* If 'from_date' and 'from_block' are provided, 'from_block' will be used.

queryParams.name: to_date
queryParams.description:
The end date from which to get the transfers (format in seconds or datestring accepted by momentjs)
* Provide the param 'to_block' or 'to_date'
* If 'to_date' and 'to_block' are provided, 'to_block' will be used.

queryParams.name: cursor
queryParams.description: The cursor returned in the previous response (used for getting the next page).

queryParams.name: limit
queryParams.description: The desired page size of the result.

responses.description: Returns a paginated collection of NFT transactions

fields.name: page
fields.description: The current page number

fields.name: page_size
fields.description: The number of results per page

fields.name: cursor

from moralis import evm_api

queryParams.name: chain

queryParams.name: block_number
queryParams.description:
The block number
* Provide the param 'block_number' or ('from_block' and / or 'to_block')
* If 'block_number' is provided in combination with 'from_block' and / or 'to_block', 'block_number' will be used

queryParams.name: from_block
queryParams.description:
The minimum block number from which to get the logs
* Provide the param 'block_number' or ('from_block' and / or 'to_block')

* If 'block_number' is provided in combination with 'from_block' and / or 'to_block', 'block_number' will be used

queryParams.name: from_date
queryParams.description:
The start date from which to get the logs (any format that is accepted by momentjs)
* Provide the param 'from_block' or 'from_date'
* If 'from_date' and 'from_block' are provided, 'from_block' will be used.
* If 'from_date' and the block params are provided, the block params will be used. Please refer to the blocks params sections (block_number,from_block and to_block) on how to use them

getPairAddress.description:
Fetch the pair data of the provided token0+token1 combination.
The token0 and token1 options are interchangable (ie. there is no different outcome in "token0=WETH and token1=USDT" or "token0=USDT and token1=WETH")

queryParams.name: chain
queryParams.description: The chain to query

queryParams.name: to_block
queryParams.description: The block number to get the reserves from

queryParams.name: to_date
queryParams.description:
Get the reserves up to this date (any format that is accepted by momentjs)
* Provide the param 'to_block' or 'to_date'
* If 'to_date' and 'to_block' are provided, 'to_block' will be used.

responses.description: Returns the pair address of the two tokens.

bodyParam.description: Request EVM challenge message.

fields.name: domain
fields.description: RFC 4501 dns authority that is requesting the signing.

fields.name: chainId
fields.description: EIP-155 Chain ID to which the session is bound, and the network where Contract Accounts must be resolved.

fields.name: address
fields.description: Ethereum address performing the signing conformant to capitalization encoded checksum specified in EIP-55 where applicable.

fields.name: statement
fields.description:
Human-readable ASCII assertion that the user will sign, and it must not contain `
`.

fields.name: uri
fields.description: RFC 3986 URI referring to the resource that is the subject of the signing (as in the __subject__ of a claim).

fields.name: expirationTime
fields.description: ISO 8601 datetime string that, if present, indicates when the signed authentication message is no longer valid.

fields.name: notBefore
fields.description: ISO 8601 datetime string that, if present, indicates when the signed authentication message will become valid.

fields.name: resources
fields.description: List of information or references to information the user wishes to have resolved as part of authentication by the relying party. They are expressed as RFC 3986 URIs separated by new lines.

fields.name: timeout
fields.description: Time in seconds before the challenge is expired

responses.description: The back channel challenge containing the id to store on the api and the message to be signed by the user

fields.name: id
fields.description: 17-characters Alphanumeric string Secret Challenge ID used to identify this particular request. Is should be used at the backend of the calling service to identify the completed request.

fields.name: message
fields.description: Message that needs to be signed by the end user
fields.example:
defi.finance wants you to sign in with your Ethereum account:
0xAb5801a7D398351b8bE11C439e05C5B3259aeC9B

Please confirm

getFilteredTokens.description: Returns filtered tokens based on specified metrics and criteria.

bodyParam.description: The request payload for filtering tokens

fields.name: chain
fields.description: The chain ID in hex format for EVM chains else solana

fields.name: filters
fields.description: Array of filter criteria

fields.name: metric
fields.description: The metric to filter on

fields.name: timeFrame
fields.description: The time frame for the filter

fields.name: gt
fields.description: Greater-than value for the filter.

fields.name: lt
fields.description: Less-than value for the filter.

fields.name: eq
fields.description: Equal to value for the filter.

fields.name: sortBy
fields.description: Sorting criteria

fields.name: metric
fields.description: Metric to sort by

fields.name: timeFrame
fields.description: Time frame for the metric

fields.name: type
fields.description: Sort direction (ASC or DESC)

fields.name: timeFramesToReturn
fields.description: List of time frames to include in the response.

fields.name: metricsToReturn
fields.description: Metrics to include in response

fields.name: limit
fields.description: Maximum number of results to return

responses.description: Returns filtered token data

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: Token metadata

fields.name: tokenAddress
fields.description: The token contract address

fields.name: chainId
fields.description: The chain ID in hex format

fields.name: name
fields.description: Token name

fields.name: symbol
fields.description: Token symbol

fields.name: decimals
fields.description: Token decimals

fields.name: logo
fields.description: URL to token logo

fields.name: blockNumberMinted
fields.description: Block number when token was minted

fields.name: usdPrice
fields.description: Current USD price of token

fields.name: security
fields.description: Security information about the token

fields.name: isOpenSource
fields.description: Whether contract is open source

fields.name: isProxy
fields.description: Whether contract is a proxy

fields.name: isMintable
fields.description: Whether token is mintable

fields.name: hiddenOwner
fields.description: Whether contract has hidden owner

fields.name: buyTax
fields.description: Buy tax percentage

fields.name: sellTax
fields.description: Sell tax percentage

fields.name: cannotBuy
fields.description: Whether token cannot be bought

fields.name: cannotSellAll
fields.description: Whether all tokens cannot be sold

fields.name: isHoneyPot
fields.description: Whether token is a honeypot

fields.name: metrics
fields.description: Token metrics data

evmRpc.description: Executes a JSON-RPC 2.0 call to retrieve Ethereum account addresses that are available on the node. This method does not require any additional parameters.

bodyParam.description: JSON-RPC 2.0 request body

fields.name: jsonrpc
fields.description: Version of the JSON-RPC protocol.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Identifier for the request, must be unique for each request.

fields.name: method
fields.description: The name of the RPC method to be invoked.

fields.name: params
fields.description: Parameters for the RPC method.

responses.description: Returns the response from RPC nodes.

body.description: Refer to the RPC schema docs for more details on the resposne definitions of each RPC method.

fields.name: jsonrpc
fields.description: Version of the JSON-RPC protocol. Will be "2.0".

fields.name: id
fields.description: Identifier for the response, matching the request id.

fields.name: result
fields.description: Refer to RPC schema docs for more details on the resposne definitions of each RPC method.

eth_blockNumber.description: Returns the number of the most recent block on the chain.

bodyParam.description: The request payload for the eth_blockNumber method.

fields.name: jsonrpc
fields.description: JSON-RPC version (typically 2.0).

fields.name: id
fields.description: The request identifier.

fields.name: method
fields.description: The JSON-RPC method being invoked.

fields.name: params
fields.description: Parameters to be passed to the method (empty for eth_blockNumber).

responses.description: Returns the current block number as a hex code.

fields.name: jsonrpc
fields.description: JSON-RPC version (typically 2.0).

fields.name: id
fields.description: The request identifier.

fields.name: result
fields.description: The current block number in hexadecimal.

eth_call.summary: Executes a new message call immediately without creating a transaction on the block chain.
eth_call.description: The eth_call method allows for the execution of a message call to a contract. It can be used to call functions on contracts without sending a transaction. This means it doesn't alter the blockchain and is executed only locally to return a response.

bodyParam.description: The request payload for the eth_call method.

fields.name: jsonrpc
fields.description: JSON-RPC version (typically 2.0).

fields.name: id
fields.description: The request identifier.

fields.name: method
fields.description: The JSON-RPC method being invoked.

fields.name: params
fields.description: Parameters for the call, including the transaction call object and optionally the block number.

responses.description: Returns the result of the contract function call.

fields.name: jsonrpc
fields.description: JSON-RPC version (typically 2.0).

fields.name: id
fields.description: The request identifier.

fields.name: result
fields.description: The returned data from the contract function, encoded.

eth_chainId.description: Returns the current chain ID, identifying the current blockchain. The chain ID is a unique identifier for each blockchain and is used for transaction signing to prevent replay attacks across chains.

bodyParam.description: The request payload for the eth_chainId method.

fields.name: jsonrpc
fields.description: JSON-RPC version (typically 2.0).

fields.name: id
fields.description: The request identifier.

fields.name: method
fields.description: The JSON-RPC method being invoked.

fields.name: params
fields.description: Parameters for the method (empty for eth_chainId).

responses.description: Returns the chain ID of the current blockchain.

fields.name: jsonrpc
fields.description: JSON-RPC version (typically 2.0).

fields.name: id
fields.description: The request identifier.

fields.name: result
fields.description: The current chain ID, as a hexadecimal.

eth_createAccessList.description: This example demonstrates generating an access list for a hypothetical transaction that interacts with a contract. The access list helps in optimizing gas costs for transactions by pre-specifying accounts and storage keys the transaction intends to access.

pathParams.name: chain
pathParams.description: The blockchain to interact with. In this example, 'eth' is used to denote Ethereum Mainnet.

pathParams.name: apiKey
pathParams.description: Your API key for authentication. Replace 'YOUR_API_KEY' with your actual Moralis API key.

bodyParam.description: The request payload for generating an access list based on a transaction object.

fields.name: jsonrpc
fields.description: Specifies the JSON-RPC protocol version, which is 2.0 for this example.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for the request.

fields.name: method
fields.description: The JSON-RPC method being called. For creating an access list, 'eth_createAccessList' is used.

fields.name: params
fields.description: An array containing the transaction object for which to generate the access list, and optionally the block number.

responses.description: Successful response with the generated access list and gas used.

fields.name: jsonrpc
fields.description: JSON-RPC protocol version.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The request identifier matching the request.

fields.name: result
fields.description: Contains the access list and the gas used for the transaction.

fields.name: accessList
fields.description: Generated access list detailing accounts and storage keys the transaction will access.

fields.name: gasUsed
fields.description: The gas used for generating the access list.

eth_estimateGas.description: Estimates the amount of gas required to execute a transaction. This method does not execute the transaction but simulates its execution to estimate the gas amount. It's useful for adjusting gas limits before sending transactions to ensure they succeed without running out of gas.

bodyParam.description: The request payload for estimating gas required for a transaction.

fields.name: jsonrpc
fields.description: JSON-RPC version (typically 2.0).

fields.name: id
fields.description: The request identifier.

fields.name: method
fields.description: The JSON-RPC method being invoked.

fields.name: params
fields.description: Parameters for the transaction to estimate gas for, including details like the sender, receiver, gas price, and value.

responses.description: Returns the estimated gas required for the transaction.

fields.name: jsonrpc
fields.description: JSON-RPC version (typically 2.0).

fields.name: id
fields.description: The request identifier.

fields.name: result
fields.description: The estimated gas amount as a hexadecimal.

eth_feeHistory.description: Retrieves historical data about transaction fees. The method returns the base fee per gas and reward (priority fee) ranges paid in each block for the requested block range. Useful for estimating appropriate fees for future transactions.

bodyParam.description: The request payload for retrieving fee history.

fields.name: jsonrpc
fields.description: JSON-RPC version (typically 2.0).

fields.name: id
fields.description: The request identifier.

fields.name: method
fields.description: The JSON-RPC method being invoked.

fields.name: params
fields.description: Parameters for the fee history request, including the number of blocks to include, the target block, and the percentile ranges of transaction fees.

responses.description: Returns historical fee data for the requested block range.

fields.name: jsonrpc
fields.description: JSON-RPC version (typically 2.0).

fields.name: id
fields.description: The request identifier.

fields.name: result
fields.description: Contains the fee history data.

fields.name: oldestBlock
fields.description: The oldest block (in hexadecimal) in the requested range.

fields.name: baseFeePerGas

field.description: Base fee per gas for each block, in hexadecimal.

fields.description: Array of base fee per gas for each block, in hexadecimal.

fields.name: gasUsedRatio

field.description: Ratio of gas used to gas limit for the block.

fields.description: Array of ratios of gas used to gas limit for each block.

fields.name: reward

field.description: Reward (priority fee) paid for the percentile.
Array containing the reward (priority fee) paid for each percentile.

fields.description: Array of arrays containing the reward (priority fee) paid for each percentile.

eth_gasPrice.description: Returns the current gas price in wei, which is the median gas price of the latest blocks. This value can be used to set the gas price for new transactions.

bodyParam.description: The request payload for retrieving the current gas price.

fields.name: jsonrpc
fields.description: JSON-RPC version (typically 2.0).

fields.name: id

fields.name: method
fields.description: The JSON-RPC method being invoked.

fields.name: params
fields.description: Parameters for the gas price request (empty for eth_gasPrice).

responses.description: Returns the current gas price in wei.

fields.name: jsonrpc
fields.description: JSON-RPC version (typically 2.0).

fields.name: id
fields.description: The request identifier.

fields.name: result
fields.description: The current gas price in wei, as a hexadecimal.
